item.title: How to Fix Shields.io Badges Not Displaying in Jenkins
item.author: xianpeng.shen@gmail.com (Xianpeng Shen)
item.description: If your Shields.io badges (like build status or documentation status) aren’t showing up in your Jenkins dashboard, it’s likely due to Jenkins’ strict Content Security Policy (CSP). I’ll show you how to temporarily fix it using the Script Console and make the change permanent by modifying Jenkins startup options. Safe for internal Jenkins setups and tested on modern Jenkins installations.

item.title: How to Change abortPrevious Value in Jenkins?
item.author: xianpeng.shen@gmail.com (Xianpeng Shen)
item.description: In Jenkins, the disableConcurrentBuilds option is used to manage concurrent builds. This article explains how to conditionally set the abortPrevious value based on the branch being built, allowing for more flexible build management.

item.title: How to use Jenkins Docker Cloud
item.author: xianpeng.shen@gmail.com (Xianpeng Shen)
item.description: This article explains how to use Jenkins Docker Cloud for building and deploying applications, including setting up a Docker host and creating custom Docker images.

Background
#

Recently, I’ve been working on migrating and upgrading Jenkins. The main motivation is the vulnerability CVE-2024-23897.

item.title: Conventional Branch Specification Released!
item.author: xianpeng.shen@gmail.com (Xianpeng Shen)
item.description:
Summary
#

Conventional Branch refers to a structured and standardized naming convention for Git branches which aims to make branch more readable and actionable. We’ve suggested some branch prefixes you might want to use but you can also specify your own naming convention. A consistent naming convention makes it easier to identify branches by type.

item.description: Sometimes you don’t want Jenkins pipeline failed for a specific error occurs. so you can use catchError to catch error and update stage or build result to SUCCESSFUL or UNSTABLE or FAILURE (if you want)

item.description:
Why Software Supply Chain Security is important?
#

Software supply chain security is the act of securing the components, activities, and practices involved in creating software.
